question: 温厚
sourceMnemonic:
When a <kanji>warm</kanji> temper is applied extra <kanji>thick</kanji>, it leads to a person having a <vocabulary>mild-mannered</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>gentle</vocabulary> personality.

Note that this is a more formal term, so you'll usually encounter it in writing.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You already know the on'yomi for <ja>温</ja>, but not for <ja>厚</ja>, so here's a mnemonic to help you remember it:

The most <vocabulary>mild-mannered</vocabulary> Tofugu staff has to be <reading>on</reading>ion <reading><ja>こう</reading>いち</ja>. It's an onion that jumps in for こういち whenever he's not at the office. He's the most <vocabulary>gentle</vocabulary> soul you could imagine, never yelling at anyone. The ideal boss, really.
